title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Eleven golfers on the Saudi-backed LIV Golf circuit, including Phil Mickelson and Bryson DeChambeau, filed an antitrust lawsuit against the PGA Tour challenging their suspensions.

---

Walmart is cutting hundreds of corporate roles in a restructuring effort, according to people familiar with the matter.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes rose, with the Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow industrials posting gains of 2.6%, 1.6% and 1.3%, respectively.

---

OPEC and its allies agreed to a small increase in oil output following calls by the U.S. and other major consumers for more supply.

---

U.S. gasoline prices have declined for seven straight weeks and are approaching an average price of $4 a gallon.

---

Warner Bros. Discovery has scrapped "Batgirl," a superhero movie that was to be sent directly to its HBOMax streaming service.

---

Airbus has canceled a deal valued at billions of dollars to supply Qatar Airways with 19 of its largest aircraft, according to people familiar with the matter.

---

Ford's July sales in the U.S. climbed 37%, rebounding sharply from year-ago production shortages and propelled by growing EV sales.

---

An attacker targeting the solana cryptocurrency ecosystem drained funds from thousands of wallets in an incident that could draw increased regulatory scrutiny to digital assets.
